segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused, like she's in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water is overflowing, pouring onto the floor, but she doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she's just standing there, polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what's going through her mind, or if she's even thinking about anything at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, taking cookies right behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don't want to interrupt her strange little moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's kind of funny, actually, how oblivious she is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before the kitchen turns into a swimming pool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but laugh at the absurdity of the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR
